title: All of My Publications
text: Make a nice table of publications with Great Tables. Include links, metrics, sparklines, etc.

title: Edward B. Quinn, PhD, MPH
text: Make a gantt chart of career. That would help tell the story.

title: Data Visualization
text:
import polars as pl
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib as plt


df = (
    pl.read_csv("death_rates.csv")
    .with_columns(pl.col("Year")
    .cast(pl.Utf8)
    .str.to_date(format="%Y"))
)


df.head()


shape: (5, 3)



Year
Cause
Age Adjusted Death Rate


date
str
f64




1900-01-01
"Heart Disease"
265.4


1901-01-01
"Heart Disease"
272.6


1902-01-01
"Heart Disease"
285.2


1903-01-01
"Heart Disease"
304.5


1904-01-01
"Heart Disease"
331.5






The year column is an integer. Make a new column where the year is a date time.
Now make a single line chart for all leading causes of death.

sns.lineplot(data = df, x = 'Year', y = 'Age Adjusted Death Rate', hue = 'Cause')








To make sure the _brand.yml style is applied to the matplotlib style sheet, see this video tutorial: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U48y0_yzEPY.
